byline.original: By DAVID JOLLY AND SEI CHONG
byline.contributor: David Jolly reported from Paris and Sei Chong from Hong Kong. Stephen Castle contributed from Brussels and Joshua Brustein from New York.

abstract: Dow Jones industrial average falls 16.88 points, or 0.2 percent, to 11,416.30; Standard & Poor's 500-stock index rises 0.65 of a point, to 1,195.54; Nasdaq composite index gains 16.98 points, or 0.7 percent, to 2,583.03.
snippet: Stocks wavered most of the day as investors awaited an important vote in Slovakia on the European bailout fund.
lead_paragraph: Stocks wavered most of the day as investors awaited an important vote in Slovakia on the European bailout fund.

headline.main: Markets End Mixed a Day After Rally
headline.print_headline: Markets End Mixed a Day After Rally
